intro: Galphimia speciosa, commonly known as the showy galphimia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that range in color from yellow to orange, often with a red or purple throat. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Galphimia speciosa thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
